page.title: 07RELIGION IN ILMINGTON
page.content: {Ilmington}has three{churches}: 1.{St.Mary the Virgin}(Church of England).This church still has its original{Norman}tower built in 1087.Its six bells are rung by a team of ringers for Sunday Services,special occasions and Tuesday evening practices.It has a childrens' choir and an adult singing group.The interior wooden furnishings of the church were carved by{Thompson}whose trade mark(a carved mouse) can be seen eleven times. 2.{Church of St.Philip}(Roman Catholic).This church has one bell and an organ.It has{stained-glass}windows on its four sides.It has a prominent position in the village.The priest lives next to the church. 3.{The Baptist Chapel.}A small chapel hidden away in the middle of Ilmington
